page.title: 17THE LEE MOOR AREA-HOUSING.
page.content: Perhaps the most significant aspect of housing in the the area is the lack of housing development presently taking place.In fact,few houses have been built in the last twenty years.Apart from several farms and cottages all the residential housing is in Lee Moor village.All of these houses are owned by the company of English China Clays. Some terraces are over one hundred and twenty years old.They were originally built for the china clay workers.Even today all of these houses are occupied by present,or retired workers in the china clay industry.The older houses were built of stone,most of which have been rendered.The roofs are covered with slates.Many people in the village use 'open' fires for heating. The thick walls of the cottages, sometimes over a metre thick,help to retain heat in the winter.
